Just like most schools, a collection of flags hung from the ceiling: flags of the different schools in the region, the flag of Japan, and of course the flag of the school itself. While this meant that there was nothing she could use for improvised coverage, Yukari nontheless felt some small comfort, as this meant that it would be likely that she wouldn't be running into any maintenance workers any time soon.

"Repeat the conditions?" Yukari asked, echoing Mitsuru's words. "What do you mean by that?"

"It's simple, really. The four of us shall return to the site of your attack and wait for any Shadows to attack." Mitsuru said. "However, in order to recreate the conditions as accurately as possible, we will need to do this unarmed..."

"Senpai, isn't that dangerous? I mean, inviting Shadows to attack us without our weapons? That just sounds like a risky plan to me." Minako said, her fears shared with Yukari.

Mitsuru nodded, crossing her arms in a defensive manner. "I realize the danger, and that is why Aigis will accompany us, and we will have our weapons and evokers hidden nearby. Should the Shadows appear, retrieving the gear necessary to protect ourselves should be a trivial matter."

It seemed as if Mitsuru had planned out the experiment as thoroughly as possible. After all, Aigis was an android designed specifically to combat Shadows, and the stash of weapons helped give the other two ladies peace of mind. So, with their gear stored safely in a large box, the four SEES members set out into the night. With Yukari leading the way back to the site of her "attack," Mitsuru and the others couldn't see the worried look on Yukari's face. There was no way this could end well for the young woman; either nothing would happen and Mitsuru would get suspicious, or they'd get attacked by Shadows. Seeing as the stripping Shadows Yukari had told Mitsuru about were completely made up, at least so far as any of them were aware, that would only serve to further discredit Yukari's story.

Finally reaching the strip mall, Yukari signaled to the others that they'd reached the right place. While Minako and Mitsuru looked for a good place to hide their box of gear, Yukari tried her best to look inconspicuous and avoid eye contact with anybody in the area. The -last- thing she needed was to see someone from last night's accidental audience. At about three minutes to midnight, however, Yukari heard a snicker and hushed whispers nearby. Looking around, she found the source of the noise to be two younger men, both looking in her direction. Yukari's cheeks burned with embarrassment when she recognized on of them from the other night, likely sharing the story of what he saw with his friend.

Thankfully for Yukari, she didn't have to endure their gaze for too long. The night sky shifted from its deep blue to an eerie green, and all sound around the four women ceased instantaneously. The Dark Hour was finally upon them.

"And so it begins." Mitsuru said. "Keep a low profile, but stay alert. We don't want the Shadows to know we're expecting them, lest we taint the experiment."

"Got it!"

"Affirmative."

"O-okay..."

And so the four young women went about their business, trying their best to seem relaxed as they waited to see what would happen. For the first half of the Dark Hour, absolutely nothing seemed to happen. With no ambient sound to break the silence of the night, Minako quickly grew restless, taking to pacing back and forth as she waited for something to happen. Mitsuru pretended to check her nails and examine herself in her compact, though Yukari assumed she was likely using the mirror to keep an eye on what was behind her. Aigis, well... Aigis simply stood completely still, lacking the need for stimulation that her human counterparts seemed to have.

"Takeba, are you sure we've recreated conditions as precisely as possible?" Mitsuru finally asked, breaking the quiet of the night.

"Er, yeah... of course!" Yukari nervously stammered. Mitsuru was starting to get suspicious, this was bad news... "I mean, do you think I'm leaving something out?"

"Well, it's simply that we have yet to see any signs of Shadow activity. Perhaps if there was something else about your situation at the time of attack, some kind of activity or noise that we should replicate, we might see better results." Mitsuru answered steadily, her voice betraying no accusations or suspicion, though Yukari wasn't sure whether the tone was natural or forced.

"Senpai has a point, Yukari-chan." Minako chimed in, finally breaking from her pacing. "I mean, anything for the sake of figuring out what's going on, right?"

"Agreed." Aigis said, surprising the other three who had almost forgotten that the robot was even present. "For the sake of tonight's mission, no details should be left out."

THIS was what Yukari had been afraid of. Now Yukari had everyone's eyes on her, and she wasn't sure she could come up with a decent lie this time (not that her lie last time had been decent, but that was beside the point). Feeling her knees begin to shake, Yukari opened her mouth to speak. "I... uh, well..."-

113332221121212112.content:
While Yukari desperately tried to think of a halfway decent way to deflect any possible suspicion, she noticed a slight movement from behind Mitsuru. It took a moment for Yukari to fully realize what she'd seen, but realization dawned quickly enough: it was a Shadow!

"Senpai, behind you!" Yukari cried.

Eyes widening in surprise, Mitsuru spun around just in time for the Shadow to crash into her midsection. The impact sent the redhead flailing to the ground, the dark creature's arms wrapped tightly around her. Shortly after hitting the ground, the sound of tearing fabric could be heard. From the sudden reddening of her cheeks and the look of shock on her face, it was plainly obvious where the sound was coming from. The Shadow was actually trying to tear off Mitsuru's blouse!

"Quickly, get it off me! Aigis, destroy it!" Mitsuru shouted, desperately pushing at the mass of darkness currently wrapped around her.

"The risk of friendly fire is too great." Aigis stated, her robotic tone giving away a hint of despair. "I cannot engage without injuring you."

Before Mitsuru could even get her next sentence out, the imperiled redhead felt a shift in the creature's weight. With the sound of a great tear, the Shadow went flying off Mitsuru, her now ruined blouse still in its grip. Looking up, Mitsuru saw her savior: Minako, her foot still raised from a strong kick, looked on in surprise and slight embarrassment as she realized what she'd just facilitated. Quickly regaining her senses, Minako knelt down, helping Mitsuru back to her feet while studiously trying to look anywhere but at her senpai's newly exposed flesh.

Both girls jumped at the sound of gunfire. With the Shadow now separated from Mitsuru, Aigis must have felt safe to engage the enemy, riddling the dark creature with dozens of bullets. The Shadow writhed in pain, went still, and dissipated. To everyone's shock, however, the ripped blouse in its hands dissipated along with it!

"I-impossible!" Mitsuru stammered out. "Why would my blouse disappear with it?"

"A question for a later time, senpai!" Minako said, hurrying to where the group's weapons were hidden. "We're not done yet!"

Looking around, the other three women realized that Minako was right. They were far from done; a small swarm of Shadows had managed to find them while they were focused on Yukari. With their ambush turned around on them, the element of surprise was on the Shadows' side! The mass of dark creatures didn't waste any time in pressing the attack, closing in as Minako desperately tried to distribute the weapons and Evokers to Mitsuru and Yukari. So focused was Minako, in fact, that she failed to notice a Shadow approaching her until it had leaped up and grabbed onto her skirt!

"Eek! NO!" Minako screamed, swatting at the Shadow. However, the creature didn't seem to mind, roughly yanking on Minako's skirt in spite of her blows. With the sound of a failing zipper, the Shadow pulled its prize right off Minako's legs, leaving the young lady with her panties openly on display! As the Shadow pulled away from Minako, Aigis quickly adjusted her stance, taking aim at the offending creature.

"Aigis, don't shoot!" Yukari shouted, doing her best to avoid the Shadows trying to advance on her at the same time. "If you kill it now, the skirt will disappear!"

However, this exposed a different problem. The Shadow with Minako's skirt, now with its prize and not under attack, quickly skittered away into the night, its retreat covered by the swarm of Shadows that remained.

"We're screwed either way!" Minako cried, awkwardly trying to cover her panties while wielding her polearm. "We've gotta kill them before they can grab anything!"

Frantically trying to fend off the sudden attack, the four SEES operatives fought bravely. With their dignity on the line, the battlefield was a mess of nerves, fear, and adrenaline. Still, the four were vastly outnumbered, and it was simply impossible to fend off every advancing Shadow. As it was, their only hope was to hold off the attack until the end of the Dark Hour without losing too much. The four women fought their hardest, and as the Dark Hour finally came to an end and the sky returned to its natural dark blue, the outcome of the battle was-

Yukari and Minako each raised an eyebrow in curiosity, while Aigis remained impassive.

"What do you mean, senpai?" Minako asked for both herself and Yukari. "How are we going to test something like that?"

Mitsuru shifted her posture, sheepishly holding an arm across her midsection to grasp her other arm. "Well, there's only one way to really determine this. We've always fought Shadows fully clothed, so, in order to determine if our state of dress has an impact, we'll have to..."

"You mean we're gonna fight Shadows naked?!" Yukari gasped, finishing the sentence Mitsuru couldn't bring herself to complete. "Senpai, that's just- that's ridiculous!"

"I'm not ecstatic about this either, Takeba. However, this Shadow behavior has to be studied to make sure it won't pose a serious threat in the future." Mitsuru explained, regaining a bit of her normal commanding stature. "And besides, if it's just the four of us, it won't be too embarrassing. Would you rather have Iori or Akihiko present?"

Mitsuru had a point, at least she would if this experiment was based on something that had actually happened. As it stood, Mitsuru was preparing to have the three of them (not counting Aigis for obvious reasons) fight Shadows naked for essentially no reason. It had been bad enough when she was naked alone, but the idea of running around with two of her friends in a similar state? Talk about embarrassing.

Minako raised her hand at this point, waiting for Mitsuru's nod of approval before speaking. "Uh, senpai, if Fuuka-chan and the others are in Tartarus, where are we going to do this experiment? I mean, don't Shadows usually stay in Tartarus?"

"Normally, yes." Mitsuru explained. "However, there are usually a few stragglers on any given night, mostly prowling for people who aren't in coffins and lack the potential to summon Personas. As such, these stragglers are usually in high-population areas."

"High population? You mean... you can't possibly mean we're going to do this downtown?!" Yukari gasped. Didn't Mitsuru realize the dangers of something like this?

"Unfortunately I do. However, that's another reason we have Aigis with us. Her internal clock can keep track of the Dark Hour and how long we have before things return to normal. So long as Aigis is with us, we'll know when it's time to get dressed."

It seemed that Mitsuru had thought of everything. So, with an increasingly nervous Yukari in tow, the four SEES members made their way through the city streets, waiting for the Dark Hour to fall. Past the Moonlight Bridge that connected Port Island with the rest of Iwatodai, Mitsuru finally decided on a good spot. Sure enough, there were plenty of people going about their business, unaware of the impending Dark Hour, and paying no mind to the four young women with concealed weaponry. In an instant, the buzz of noise from the people stopped and the sky took on an eerie green glow. Coffins stood where there were once people, and blood had appeared on surfaces all over. The Dark Hour had arrived.

"It's time." Mitsuru said, slowly reaching for the buttons on her blouse. "Everyone, please disrobe."

The silence was awkward as the girls undressed, the three humans unwilling to look each other in the eye, or anywhere else for that matter. The only one not bothered was Aigis, who stood watch. Once the other three were finished Mitsuru spoke up once again.

"Okay. Now we wait. Assuming we encounter a Shadow, we are all to keep an eye on its behavior. We know their normal behavior, so take note of anything unusual. We have to get to the bottom of this. Aigis, how long do we have?"

"The Dark Hour will end in fifty-four minutes and sixteen seconds."

"Very good. We've got almost an hour, so let's make the most of it. Keep your eyes peeled for Shadows everyone. Aigis, please notify us at every ten minute interval of remaining time, then every minute of the last five."

"Understood."

Fifty minutes.

Forty minutes.

Thirty minutes.

Twenty minutes.

Ten minutes.

After the majority of the Dark Hour had passed without incident, Minako let out an irritated sigh. "Come on! After all we did for this experiment we can't get a single Shadow to show up?"

"If nothing appears tonight, we'll simply have to repeat the experiment another day." Mitsuru said, leaning against a nearby wall. Minako and Yukari both let out another sigh at Mitsuru's declaration; one night had been ridiculous enough, but now Mitsuru was going to make them keep this up? A Shadow had better appear soon...

As if on cue, Aigis sunk into her battle pose, fingertips retracting as she readied her machine guns. "Shadow sighted!"

"There we are! Get ready everyone, and keep your eyes peeled!" Mitsuru called, grabbing up her rapier and evoker, Yukari and Minako close behind.

There were several Shadows, enough for each girl to have her hands full. Blows were exchanged, Personas were summoned, and victory was achieved. By the end of it, the three human SEES members were panting in exhaustion. The fight hadn't been as easy as they'd hoped. Indeed, things had been a bit dicey until Minako busted out her strongest Personas.

"Hm. Nothing unusual about their behavior" Mitsuru noted. "It seems that our clothing had nothing to do with it."

Yukari gulped. Mitsuru was about to figure out that it had all been a lie! She was doomed!

"Perhaps it's only certain types of Shadow. Or it was the fact that we had our evokers." Mitsuru continued, resulting in an unnoticed sigh of relief from Yukari.

"Five minutes remaining in the Dark Hour."

"Five? Oh, wow. Guys, we need to get dressed quickly!" Minako said, dashing back to where she and the others had left their clothes. However, what Minako and the others saw was-

Nervously, Yukari placed her hands against the rough brick wall of the building, her body tensing as she prepared for whatever Mitsuru had in store for her. At first, the only thing Yukari heard was the sharp click of Mitsuru's boots against the pavement, the older girl pacing back and forth. Mitsuru had just drawn in a breath when the commotion began.

"May I have your attention please?" Came a slimy voice from in the back.

Mitsuru froze in shock. At the back of the auditorium stood a shirtless man with pale skin and long white hair. Mitsuru knew him instantly. Takaya Sakaki. He was a disturbed young man who led a small circle of Persona Users with an apparent deathwish for the human race. What little they knew about him was troubling: The Kirijo Group had at one time engaged in experiments to forcefully bring out a Persona in a human host. The experiment had proven a failure. While some hosts did manage to manifest a Persona, the being so manifested proved difficult to control and at times openly hostile to the one it was bonded to. The first experiments resulted in the Persona eventually turning on the host and strangling the life from them. Drugs were created to suppress the power of the User to prevent the Persona from breaking free. But those drugs had their own side effects, most obviously a sharp decline in mental stability. STREGA was a group made up of the discarded experiments of Kirijo, a twisted combination of a street gang and suicide cult for Persona Users led by Takaya. His motivations were still unknown, but he seemed to actively oppose the goals of SEES in general and Mitsuru's group in particular. Whatever endgame the Shadows intended, Takaya was evidently eager to be their wingman.

Mitsuru stared daggers at him as he made his way down the aisle. Carefully she began to reach for her Evoker.

"Let's not be hasty." Takaya said, drawing a large revolved from his jeans and firing once into the air. Someone screamed.

"CALM YOURSELVES." Takaya shouted, his eyes never leaving Mitsuru. "Please remain seated. I would hate to waste more bullets just because of a few antsy children."

Mitsuru breathed in sharply. "Do as he says everyone."

Takaya smiled, and flipped open a cell phone with his free hand. "Jin, are you in?"

"You bet. Their security is a joke. Right now the school is on a solid lockdown. And all security cameras are live and rolling." Came the voice over the land.

"Splendid." Takaya said, an oily smile on his face. "Hello, everyone. I'm afraid your time at the assembly is going to be a bit longer than expected. We find ourselves in need a few hostages, and you fit the bill far too well. But do not worry. I have nothing personal against...most of you. Make no fuss, and there is every possibility you will get out of this alive and whole. How likely the possibility is, unfortunately, hinges largely on whether are demands are met. But I'm certain we can negotiate an equitable arrangement."

Mitsuru's mind was reeling. What was this madman thinking? He could not have picked a worse day to do this (from her perspective). Aigis was undergoing repairs after a night spent in the labryrinth. Ken, Akihiko, and Junpei were likewise bed ridden from the debilitating effects of Tartarus. This was a crisis and half her people were unavailable.

"What do you want?" She demanded.

"We demand restitution for the crimes of the Kirijo Group." Takaya said with a smile. "They have violated innumberable environmental and human rights over the years. We are a group who demands justice."

Mitsuru paused. That...was not unreasonable in and of itself. The Kirijo Group prior to her father's takeover had been a corporation filled with deadly ambition and steeped in corruption. Their crimes against STREGA were only one example of this. Both Mitsuru and her father were determined to make up for the sins of the corporation. That being said...

"I understand how you feel. But you must realize that threatening the lives of innocent people will not change the past." Mitsuru said.

"Really, Mrs. Kirijo? Attempting to reason with a terrorist with a gun? Have you not followed your local media? We are all madmen devoid of compassion and bent on creating chaos." Takaya said.

Mitsuru glared again. Was this just a game to him. "...You said you had demands..."

"Indeed. And they are simple. First, I would like you to step out from behind the podium."

Mitsuru complied, her heart pounding.

"Good. Now, I would like Yukari Takeba, Fuuka Fuuka Yamagishi, and Minako Arisato to stand up. Oh, and do loosen your grip on those little toys of yours ladies. I'm well aware of your movements. You aren't going to catch me off guard. And really, what do you intend? Even if you did manage to use those silly little faux pistols, what then? I'm surrounded by your fellow students. Are you going to give away all your secrets here and now? Can you stop me before my pistol goes off? What could you even do to me that has enough punch to be effective that won't endanger all your fellows?"

As one Mitsuru's teammates reluctantly drew their hands away from where their Evokers were holstered. Even more reluctantly they stood. Takaya walked with a swagger to the front of the auditorium. He shoved a large black trashcan onto the stage next to him.

"All right ladies. I think I'll make my first demand simple. You each come to me, drop off your little toy pistols in the garbage, and then join your senpai on stage. For each pistol that goes in the can, a hostage goes free. Why don't we begin with you, Kirijo-san?"

Mitsuru reluctantly withdrew her Evoker and tossed it into the trashcan in one smooth motion. She had no means left to summon a Persona! One by one her teammates complied.

"Very good. Now all of you, stand on stage. Keep your hands behind your head unless I'm giving you other instructions. Oh, and keep your knees shoulder width apart."

The girls exchanged looks, but complied.

The students practically bolted out the door, which unlocked at Jin's command.

He was very, very sure that they were making it up, but who knew what anyone would do after being imprisoned in a closet naked for a full day without food or water. Arata had said that the drugs would make the time pass for them in the blink of an eye, but to be honest, Shoji thought that Arata was a few screws loose himself.

"AARGH!" Odagiri gasped. "My neck! Grgh!"

"MMM! SO GOOD!" Chihiro growled, sounding nearly inhuman.

"Oh God," Mitsuru sobbed. "Oh my God... It's just me and her now. I'm next... Please, save me! I'll let you do whatever you want to me, just don't let me die!"

That was enough to send Shoji running for the door. The prospect of Mitsuru as his own personal slave was just too much to pass up. Also, he was curious as to what depraved, beastly state Chihiro had been reduced to. Always watch out for the shy ones, his brother had told him whenever he asked him advice on girls. Shoji unlocked and opened the door, fully intent on claiming his prize-

-and was met with a triple-sized body slam shoving him into a nearby wall cabinet, bumping his head on the fixture and knocking him unconscious.

"Tres Bien!" Mitsuru cheered, giving Shoji's unconscious body a kick for good measure. "Now to release us from these bonds," she said, kneeling down to search his pockets for anything she could use.

"I can't believe that actually worked..." Odagiri mumbled. "He actually believed you were a zombie?"

"Zombie? I was going for werewolf..." Chihiro sighed.

"That's not what I'm getting at," Odagiri tried to continue.

"She could have been a vampire for all I care," Mitsuru interrupted. "Regardless, the plan worked splendidly, and it turns out that our friend here had a knife in his coat pocket. Yet another infraction of the rules, but one that works in our favor this time."

Taking the knife, Mitsuru was able put her wrist ropes along the blade and free herself. After that, it was only a short few minutes to cut the rest of the ropes, freeing the naked trio. Upon being freed, Chihiro immediately shoved Mitsuru aside as she ran into the Student Council room. Mitsuru followed, suprised at the girl's sudden rush, to see her dashing around the room, frantically looking for something. Half a minute later, it was apparent that her search was fruitless, as she sank to her knees and turned towards Mitsuru, arms covering her chest. "It's not here," Chihiro groaned. "It's all gone..."

It took a moment for Mitsuru to realize that she meant their clothes. Looking over her shoulder, she saw that Odagiri was also devastated, his hands firmly placed in front of his crotch as he entered the room. "Of course they wouldn't leave our uniforms out where we could just pick them up," Mitsuru spoke out loud. "It's possible that they may have disposed of them yesterday while we were unconscious."

"Oh..." Odagiri and Fushimi both groaned.

Mitsuru was about to chide them for moping around when action needed to be done when she realized that she couldn't really blame them. The only reason she hadn't fallen into a quivering ball covering her privates was because of extenuating circumstances: Arata needed to be stopped. Becoming overwhelmed by embarrassment or shame would do nothing to help that. All the same, she knew that the others didn't have her strength.

"Pardon me for a moment," she said, moving back to the closet, leaving the other two despondent and alone. A minute later, she returned, carrying a bundle in her hands.

"Here," she said, tossing its contents at Odagiri and Fushimi.

"What? This is?" Odagiri started.

"Shoji's uniform," Mitsuru finished. "These uniforms are for Gekkoukan students only. What Arata and his henchman have done is tantamount to treason. Suffice to say, they won't be needing their uniforms any more."

"But, Mitsuru-san," Chihiro asked, wasting no time to put on Shoji's shirt. "What about you? You can't possibly mean to move around while you're all, you know... naked?"

Mitsuru glanced down at her own body, completely and utterly bare, and back to the others, nervously averting their gazes. She was surprised to realize that the thought of covering herself with the borrowed uniform had never occurred to her. "Truth be told," Mitsuru began, starting to blush at being reminded of her predicament. "There is nothing I would rather be right now than fully dressed with everything back to normal. But I cannot do it in good conscience while leaving my close companions out in the cold." She looked at Odagiri and Fushimi, now decently covered up in a pair of pants and a shirt, respectively, and was pleased to see their confidence slowly being restored. "A true President puts the well-being of the people before her own. I could be covering up right now, but what would that solve? Right now all my efforts need to be focused on stopping this mad scheme. The time is now- 9:55!?" she sputtered, looking at the clock. "There's no time left! Quickly, to the PA Room," she announced, cutting her motivational speech short, throwing the door open and rushing out into the hall.

The hallway was empty, no doubt because everyone was already in the auditorium, meeting for the morning assembly. Not that it mattered to Mitsuru. She only had a scant few minutes to spare! With an emboldened Chihiro and Odagiri fast on her heels, she reached the PA Room and threw the door open.
1221321221.title: Enact Escape Plan.

choices: Finale
12213212211.content:
The PA room was mostly empty, save for two students near the monitors. Mitsuru recognized them as Emiko, and the tall boy who had accosted Chihiro earlier, not that his name mattered at all at that moment.

"What the-?" Emiko gasped. "You managed to escape? And still naked, I see... Did Little Mitsuru come for another dose of punishment?" she sneered.

Mitsuru nostrils flared, her lips turning back in a sort of snarl. "It is the end of the line for you!" she yelled defiantly, arms at her sides.

"What, you guys?" Emiko said mockingly. "Three people wearing a total of one uniform is supposed to scare us?"

"Y-you're outnumbered!" Chihiro surprisingly spoke up, looking the angriest Mitsuru ever saw the girl, fists balled in front of her. "You're gonna pay for what you did to us!"

"It's too late," the boy taunted. "The video's already uploaded into the computer. At 10:05, it will start playing out in the auditorium and everyone will see your little show. You know, thanks to that little teaser we sent out and you not being at the assembly, everyone's talking about you already. Just imagine what they will be saying after today, ha ha!"

"That's enough!" Odagiri yelled, charging the boy.

With a grunt, Chihiro did likewise towards Emiko.

Still in the doorway, Mitsuru sized up the situation carefully. Things looked even right now in the battle, but if her allies' sudden burst of energy petered out, they would soon be at a disadvantage. Odagiri had locked hands with his opponent, apparently challenging him in a match where the stronger competitor would prevail. Chihiro and Emiko, on the other hand, were fighting in a style more similar to boxing. That is to say, the most amateurish boxing Mitsuru had ever witnessed, with wild punches swinging off target for both sides, interrupted only by the occasional blow to the noggin. Her friends' efforts were admirable, but Mitsuru knew that it wouldn't last long. Malnourished as they were, their strength would soon drain away, leaving them at the mercy of their enemies. Knowing that she had to stop these two before she could safely stop the video from playing, she looked around the room, searching for anything that could help. Soon enough, Mitsuru had her plan.

Sneaking around behind the combatants, she made her way to the wall with the monitors. Taking a page from Odagiri's book, she hoisted a nearby folding chair and, fueled by her adrenaline alone, charged the tall boy and hit him on the back of the head with as much force as she could muster. Fortunately, arms otherwise occupied and completely unable to defend any blows from behind, the boy crumpled to the floor like a sack of bricks.

"Now!" Mitsuru yelled, gesturing towards where Emiko and Chihiro were continuing to duke it out.

"Right!" Odagiri replied, charging Emiko and making the match a two-on-one, quickly shifting things in their favor.

With the traitors sufficiently disposed of and occupied, Mitsuru made her way to the computer at the monitors and sat in the chair. Looking at the clock, the time was 10:03. They made it with two minutes to spare! Using her personal password, she was able to access the computer camera logs and gain access to alter the video playlist, despite it being locked in earlier.

"Hah! Go ahead and try! It won't do you any good." Emiko yelled.

Mitsuru turned around. The duo had succeeded in holding her down on the floor, but Emiko's face remained locked in an expression of triumph.

"Arata has the last phone on him!" she continued. "Even if you stop the video here, he will send it out on his own from that phone right there on stage. And it won't be limited to a small group of friends, he's set it up to go to everyone in the school right here and now!"

"Krr..." Mitsuru growled. She looked at the assembly through the auditorium monitor. Arata had taken to the podium and was gesturing to the crowd. Most likely he was preparing them for the show that was yet to come. There was simply not enough time. One way or another, her naked body was going to be shown to everyone.

She had failed...

...but she hadn't given up yet, despite everything she had been through, and she wasn't going to start now. There was still one option left to her. It was an unpleasant one, but it was the only option remaining.

Mitsuru fiddled with the computer a bit more, making sure everything was in place before hitting CONFIRM, just before 10:05.

-----

"...and without further ado, a side of your Student Council President that you've never seen before, that I am sure will change your opinion of her," Arata said, concluding his opening speech with a bow.

Students and faculty alike muttered confused whispers. This assembly was supposed to be about the update for the new club itineraries over the summer. The last thing they expected was a last minute change to an impeachment hearing against Mitsuru, claiming her unfit for office, of all things. But Arata had insisted that all will be made clear after seeing a video Mitsuru had apparently shot of herself on campus that he had been able to acquire somehow. A lot of this seemed sketchy, but between that and rumors of that mysterious sexy photo from Saturday, anything was possible, so they all decided to sit back and see what was in store.

Their confusion intensified as the video began. The opening scene was nothing scandalous. It was just the Student Council Room, during a normal everyday meeting. The angle and timestamp in the corner of the footage made it appear as though it was taken from a security camera this past Saturday, during the normal meeting times. Due to being shown on the large screen, everyone could be made out clearly. Arata's eyes bugged out as he saw that this wasn't what he planned to show. With everyone's eyes and ears focused on the video, no one noticed him as he quickly crouched down and dialed Emiko's cell number from his personal phone. His face went from white to red as the voice on the other end was not Emiko's at all.

"Hello, Arata," Mitsuru spoke.

"What do you think you're doing, Kirijo!?" Arata whispered hoarsely. "How did you escape? Never mind that, don't you know that I'm going to send your sordid actions out to everyone if the proper video doesn't show!?"

"Yes," Mitsuru replied matter-of-factly. "Your co-conspirator was quite insistent that if I tried to stop your broadcast, you'd send it out anyway."

"Exactly! You lost! So what are you trying to pull? How did you get that footage!?"

"Indeed, no matter what I did, it was clear that my humiliation would be made public to everyone. So, I figured, why not give everyone the extended, uncut version? As for how I acquired this, is it really that surprising? Wasn't it you who said that the Kirijo group holds too much power everywhere?"

"Don't act all smug with me! I'm uploading the video and sending links to everyone right now!"

Mitsuru said nothing.

Just then a mixture of gasps and laughter roared through the auditorium. The video had just reached the part where Mitsuru's blouse got caught in the filing cabinet and was torn off completely. "Hear that?" Arata crowed through the laughter, which peaked again after Chihiro had to point the obvious out to the perplexed President. "You're a laughingstock now! Your humiliation has only just begun! It will be even worse once everyone gets to view a free replay on their phones!"

"Yes, I can see it clearly from here," Mitsuru continued, her tone remaining calm and unperturbed. "I did simply just stand there like a slack-jawed buffoon, didn't I? Giving a full view of my brassiere to everyone in the room. I really do look quite the fool. But do you remember what happened next, Arata?"

"Next, what do you mean nex-! !!!" he froze up in realization.

"It seems you have finally caught on," Mitsuru continued, an edge becoming apparent in her voice. "The next thing to come off was indeed my brassiere, but that was not due to mere chance, was it?"

"Stop it..." he faintly whispered.

"What was that?"

"Stop it, now!" he said, nearly breaking his whisper.

"But why?" Mitsuru asked condescendingly. "You already sent out the incomplete video. I'm just giving everyone the complete story. Aren't I such a gracious host?"

"I-I lied!" Arata lied, struggling to regain control. "Obviously that was just a bluff to get you to stop this! Come on, we can still work this out reasonably, man to woman, all right?"

"I'm afraid that ship is about to set sail," said Mitsuru.

Just then, a collective gasp echoed throughout the room, as the video reached the part where Arata snuck up behind Mitsuru, removed her bra from her body, and then proceeded to taunt her with it.

"Dammit all!" Arata swore, cutting the call and quickly making his exit while everyone was distracted by Mitsuru's breasts.
12213212211.title: Inside the PA Room

122132122111.content:
Back in the PA room, Odagiri and Chihiro stared indescribably at the screen where the camera footage was playing as well as Mitsuru, sitting in the chair in front of the computer. The video had reached its climax, with Mitsuru being forced to perform that awful dance while Chihiro was being held for hostage. Though the video was muted in this room, it was likely that every gasp and moan could be heard in the auditorium right now, where the audio rang clearly. Mitsuru herself betrayed no emotion, simply setting down Emiko's phone on the desk after Arata hung up, just staring at the monitors, not making a single response. Even Emiko had shut up, utterly baffled at Mitsuru's final option. Unable to take it any longer, Odagiri was the first to break the silence. "Mitsuru-san, are you... alright?" he asked.

"No, I am far from alright," Mitsuru responded, her voice as cold as her element. "It goes without saying that I am greatly disappointed in this entire affair. The most intimate details of my body are now common knowledge amongst the entire school, that vile video exists on everyone's phones, and to add insult to injury I am nearly dying of hunger, but at the very least I can take solace in the fact that everyone will know Arata's true role in this debacle, as well as that the video they have just recieved is nothing more than a gross distortion of the truth."

"Wh-What's gonna happen to us?" Emiko asked, beginning to cry. "We were just following Arata's orders, nothing more!"

"Of course you were," Mitsuru said dismissively, keeping her back towards the room. "Due to the extreme lengths Arata himself went to, any one of you could claim to the proper authorities that he forced you into this, and they would most certainly believe you. However," Mitsuru turned her head to look Emiko straight in her eyes. "I will never forget what all of you did to me, Odagiri, and Fushimi. Any further disloyalty will be met with the most severe consequences."

"Ah! I'm sorry, I'm so, so, sorry!" Emiko launched into a string of feeble apologies. Mitsuru didn't pay much attention, though she did feel the slightest relief that the proper order had been restored at last. She turned back to the video, where their first struggle had ended in disaster, where all three of them were tazed into unconsciousness. With all of the relevant information having finished its broadcast, she contemplated letting the video continue to play further, but stopped it as she saw them gather around Chihiro and Odagiri's bodies and began to fiddle with their uniforms. There was no need to let it go any further.

"What's going to happen to Arata, anyway?" Chihiro asked, shuddering at the last image she saw before the view cut off.

"Sexual Harassment of multiple students, confining them against their will without proper nutrition, drugging them, conspiracy to frame one of those students as a perverted, sexual deviant," Mitsuru rattled off. "Expulsion at the very least. That is, if they're able to find him after he ducked out of the assembly. If he's smart then he's probably at the train station, booking a ticket to 'I Don't Give Two Shits'-ville."

The others shrunk back at the sheer venom in Mitsuru's voice.

"KIRIJO!" A voice cried out, slamming at the door. "You bitch! Open this door!"

"But we all know better by now, don't we?" Mitsuru asked rhetorically. "I see no reason to, Arata," she called out. "Why did you come crawling back here anyway?"

"I'm ruined thanks to you!" he yelled. "If I'm going to burn for this, you can bet I'm taking you with me!"

"Funny," she continued, her voice completely serious. "Because from my perspective, that's exactly what you forced me to do to you. I tire of repeating myself to fools who fail to grasp basic concepts such as that."

"Oh, you thought I was bad before!?" Arata yelled, nearly incoherently, pummeling the door with all his might. "When I get in there, I'm going to make you regret ever standing up to me! Regret ever being born, even! Five minutes is all I need to- GUH!"

The sudden outburst was the last noise he uttered, silence filling the room.

"That's enough out of you," a male voice spoke from outside.

"Mitsuru-senpai, are you in there?" A familiar female voice rang clearly.

"Minako-chan!" Odagiri and Fushimi shouted.

"Let them in," Mitsuru directed towards the door, swivelling around in the chair to face the door.

Just as she expected, she recognized the two figures standing to greet her outside the door. A young brunette girl wearing the school uniform, Minako-chan, and a silver-haired boy around Mitsuru's age, wearing a vest and holding his jacket off to the side. The two were quite shocked to see Mitsuru sitting in the chair wearing only her serious expression, but with her arms and legs crossed to conceal herself.

"It's about time you showed up, Akihiko-kun, Minako-chan," Mitsuru greeted them, shaking them free of their stupor. "It's rude to keep a lady waiting, you know."

"Akihiko-senpai, your coat!" Minako said.

"Oh, right!" Akihiko replied, handing it over while Minako rushed to Mitsuru.

"Mitsuru-senpai!" Minako wept, barely able to contain herself, handing over the jacket. "I couldn't believe my own eyes. The nerve of that guy! When you didn't show up at the dorm I checked back at the Council room for you-"

"I know, Minako-chan," Mitsuru interrupted as she put it on. Fortunately, it was able to stretch down her thighs, but only barely. "They kept us imprisoned against our will, and lied to prevent anyone from checking for us."

"Oh, Mitsuru-senpai... Chihiro-chan, Odagiri-kun," she addressed to the other members standing in the room. "It must have been so horrible..."

Chihiro broke down into tears and embraced Minako tightly. "It was rough for all of us, but Mitsuru-san most of all," said Odagiri.

"All this, and you still put yourself on the line to make sure that dirtbag wouldn't get away with it," said Akihiko.

"He still was able to cause irreparable damage," Mitsuru said morosely. "I don't think anyone will ever forget that video, and the worst of them have the version he made sitting right on their phones for their personal amusement."

"Perhaps, but fortunately they won't ever get a chance to see it again," Akihiko grinned.

"What?" Mitsuru fixed him with her stare.

"As soon as the video ended, and realizing that the mail everyone received was Arata's dirty ploy, the faculty blocked the exits and confiscated everyone's phones," he continued. "Thing is, most of the students were handing them over willingly."

"Yeah," Minako added. "I took a look at the people's faces during the crowd, and as soon as Arata started threatening you and Chihiro, almost everyone changed from laughter to hate. People were actively turning away during that forced dance and outright booing after he shocked you all unconscious!"

"Though not everyone, I take it?" Mitsuru asked. She was not naive enough to believe that the video was completely eradicated, nor was her humiliation completely met with revulsion.

"Er... no..." Minako replied glumly. "But there's always those creeps sitting out there, caring about nothing but their own sick fantasies. You can't let them get you down!" she said, attempting to cheer Mitsuru up.

After a pause, Mitsuru sighed and took a great big stride forward, walking towards the exit. "Enough standing around here," she said. "It's time we all got something decent to wear and a nice, hot meal to eat."

Everyone gathered around her. It was a very good idea at this point.

"What do we do with him?" Akihiko pointed at Arata.

Mitsuru took a long look at Arata's body collapsed on the ground, his cheek swollen and glasses cracked from Akihiko's punch. She wanted so badly to give him a kick between the ribs, but she had to be the bigger woman here. It wasn't easy being President, after all. "Take him to the faculty offices," Mitsuru commanded. "I wish to be rid of him as soon as possible."

"You got it," he replied, hoisting the body over one shoulder and taking it away.

Arata's punishment was as swift and severe as Mitsuru had predicted. Fortunately, this also resulted in Mitsuru never having to see his ugly mug ever again. The other conspirators quickly fell back in line, and were more than willing to give up to triple their previous work efforts, given the right incentives from Mitsuru, Chihiro, or Odagiri, of course. Just as Mitsuru had worried, however, her ears still picked up occasional snickers from various students, and even a couple of teachers. These remarks would occasionally force her to remember that horrible dance, but only for a second. Under her withering stare, these noises were soon silenced every time, without fail, and life would carry on.

1222.content:
rrrriiiiip!

The sound of tearing fabric was hard to miss, especially as the room fell silent almost immediately after it started. Mitsuru, surprised as she was by the sound, took a few seconds to fully comprehend what had happened. She was used to most eyes in the student council room being on her, but not quite like this. Chihiro's hands were clasped over her mouth in shock, Odagiri was actually making a point of looking at anything except Mitsuru, and the rest of the council members were either staring openly or trying to avert their eyes. Mitsuru wondered what was wrong. Was their something on her face? Had she said something offensive without realizing it?

Chihiro was, surprisingly, the one to break the silence. With one trembling hand pointing at the Kirijo heiress, the timid treasurer squeaked out "S-s-senpai! Your skirt!"

That was when Mitsuru looked down. While she had assumed to see her skirt torn, finally realizing what the tearing sound must have been, the sight she was greeted with was far worse. Rather than the black fabric of her skirt, Mitsuru only saw the bottom of her blouse covering her lacy black panties! Behind her, still hanging from the closed filing cabinet, hung the torn remains of her skirt. Mitsuru was flashing her panties to the entire Student Council! For once, the calm and collected Mitsuru was at an absolute loss for words and had no immediate resolution in mind.

Her first order of business was to try and cover herself. With only her hands to aid her, Mitsuru's efforts were weak at best as her delicate palms flattened across her front, though plenty of fine black lace was still openly visible. Her second order of business was to turn her head and inspect her ruined skirt. It looked as if the seam had failed completely and ripped apart under the strain of being held by the drawer as Mitsuru walked. In any case, the skirt would need some serious mending to function properly again.

Still, the biggest problem was that the Student Council, classmates and underclassmen all meant to look up to and respect Mitsuru, were now being treated to a peep show of her unmentionables. This absolutely would not do, and Mitsuru had to come up with a solution to the situation before her image was damaged any more than it just had been. To this end, Mitsuru realized that she needed to get some proper cover for her lower half. But how?

She could try to wrench open the cabinet and salvage her skirt, of course. The considerable damage would mean that Mitsuru would need to keep both hands on it to keep it on, assuming she could even pull it out in the first place. The skirt was hanging from the corner of the drawer, and the fabric might have jammed the slide the drawer moved along, essentially locking it up tight. Plus, doing this would mean exposing her backside to the room while both her hands were occupied with the drawer...

The second possible solution would be to run away. Get out of the room and try to find somewhere to hide. Then she could at least try to think of a more complete solution, and perhaps even find something to cover herself up with. Of course, that would mean running through the halls of the school with no skirt on...

Lastly, Mitsuru could try to appeal to the room for help. Perhaps someone could loan her a school jacket that she could tie around her waist? It wouldn't be perfect, but it would at least be something. Assuming, of course, that anybody was willing to do that for her. While Mitsuru was popular and loved, she was also envied, and there's no telling who might jump at the chance to make the redheaded beauty squirm...
1222.title: Skirt

choices: Workable.
Completely unsalvagable.
12221.content:
Weighing the options she had in her head, Mitsuru quickly discarded any thoughts of escape, despite strongly wanting to at that moment. Not only would it send a message of weakness towards the Student Council and, by extension, the entire school, but today was the deadline for finishing the new budget plans for all of the school clubs. Between everything on Mitsuru's busy plate, this meeting right now was the only chance she had to review and approve of this year's plan. The issue was, without her approval, the plan could not be submitted, and if the plan wasn't submitted today, then the 30 or so clubs all around the school would be completely without funds for the next three months, the blame for which would all be placed squarely on her shoulders, obviously.

As for seeking aid from the other students, Mitsuru looked around the room once more to see if any would be willing. Unfortunately, the warm weather meant that not a single person had a jacket, sweater, scarf, or other superfluous garment of sufficient coverage. And according to the glances most of the boys kept making, it seemed they would rather like it the longer she was left like this. In fact, the shock her sudden disrobement had on all of the council members was beginning to fade away. For the girls as well, frozen stares were slowly melting away to wry smiles of amusement, and those that had turned their gazes of our respect or fear were quickly diminishing, all eyes returning front and center. As whispers and stifled laughter began to creep up from the back of the room, Mitsuru knew that she had to act now.

Maintaining her hands in front of her panties and putting on her best poker face, Mitsuru addressed the Council, "It seems I have had some difficulty with the filing cabinets. Please, allow me a moment before we continue."

Several of the students blinked in response, a few mouths parted lips as if to say something, but no one did.

Good, everyone is silent again. I believe that has bought me some time, Mitsuru thought to herself.

Taking a deep, silent breath, Mitsuru turned around to face the filing cabinet, tugged the back of her blouse as far down as it could go, which unfortunately wasn't very much, and examined the cabinet in front of her. Just as her cursory glance had informed her, one of the side seams had torn apart completely, splitting the skirt evenly down its entire length. She grasped the skirt with one hand and gave it a couple quick pulls. Nothing. She then knelt a little to test the cabinet drawer. It remained shut.

Mitsuru grimaced. It looked like brute force was going to be her only option in retrieving her skirt. It would be disastrous if it ripped more, but she figured that If she could get it out at least mostly intact, she might be able to use some of the office supplies to salvage it in some way, allowing her to continue the meeting with at least some decorum.

"Fushimi," Mitsuru spoke firmly.

"Y-yes?" Chihiro, who moments ago was taking a fascination to the ceiling tiles, replied nervously.

"I need your assistance," Mitsuru directed, pointing at the cabinet drawer. "When I give the word, lift and pull the drawer."

"Um, okay," she said, nodding and doing her best to keep her eyes at or above chest level.

With Chihiro in position, Mitsuru crouched to ready herself to free her garment. She winced as she could feel her blouse sliding up above her hips, realizing that, bent over as she was, she her panty-clad posterior was now completely exposed to the entire council. Just 30 seconds, that's all I will need, she thought, doing her best to keep herself motivated enough to stay in control.

"Ready, pull!" Mitsuru commanded.

With a heave, Mitsuru dug her heels into the floor and tugged at her skirt, while Chihiro tried her best to work the drawer loose. Unfortunately, after three full attempts, neither skirt nor cabinet were making any leeway.

As she paused to catch her breath, Mitsuru could hear whispers rising again. She was starting to lose control of the room, and she knew it. This is turning into a complete fiasco... Do they seriously not think I can hear them, their snickers at how my bottom wiggles as I attempt to preserve my modesty?

Mitsuru gritted her teeth, and made one last attempt, pouring all of her strength into pulling backwards. With the resistance this endeavor had provided thus far, Mitsuru was caught off guard as the skirt gave way with a loud tear. However, her excess momentum sent her hurdling backwards, stumbling into the center table with a loud thud, and falling to the floor.

Adding insult to injury, a nearby water bottle one of the students had carelessly left uncapped at the edge of the table was knocked over from the impact, drenching the unfortunate redhead with its contents.

Incomprehensibly muttering under her breath, Mitsuru cleared her wet hair from the face to find a good portion of her skirt in her hands. As for its condition, it was-
12221.title: Mitsuru fights with the filing cabinet.

Hold it together! Stay in the room.
122212.content:
Mitsuru's face fell as she surveyed what remained of her skirt. While she had managed to free a fair amount of it from the cabinet, it hadn't been freed in good condition. Rather than a solid piece of fabric, Mitsuru held a ragged chunk of her skirt, loose threads and dangling scraps hanging in every direction. Fuuka carefully walked to her desk, aware of the gazes from her fellow students. Taking her seat, she tried to focus on the lecture, to no avail. She kept replaying everything in her head. So many things could have gone wrong, so many chances for them to be seen, but somehow, they both made it through okay. It was quite an adventure, all right. Fuuka took a deep breath and shook her head. There would be time to reflect on everything in detail when she was safe in her room, right now, she just had to focus for the rest of class, and then head on home when the period ended.

The lecture continued, but as Fuuka tried to pay attention to the class, she noticed movement out of the corner of her eye. Was that girl looking at her? Fuuka glanced at her, only for the girl to turn back towards her workbook. Then, she saw two boys sitting in front of her whispering to each other. But just as she noticed, they too, turned back to their work. Fuuka grew nervous. What could they have been talking about? Was it about her?

Fuuka's unease continued until ten minutes before the bell, when-

There is no other choice.  Or do you want executions (BAD END)
13313122211111.content:
A student Fuuka didn't know entered the room. "Excuse me," he addressed the teacher.

"What is it?" the teacher replied.

"I am here for Fuuka Yamagishi," the student stated. "The student council has business with her."

"We are nearly finished with today's lecture," the teacher said dismissively. "Just wait until the top of the hour."

"I'm sorry, but Kirijo-san was strongly insistent that she be brought to her immediately."

The mention of Mitsuru's name sent all the students into hushed chatter, and sent Fuuka's blood to a chill.

"Kirijo, eh?" the teacher frowned. "Well, you heard him, Yamagishi, go!" he snapped towards Fuuka.

"Ah! Y-yes!" Fuuka stammered, getting up from her seat.

As she walked towards the door, she could hear the other students' whispers more clearly. "Kirijo..." "What trouble has she gotten into?" "Wait, could she have been-" "Sh!"

"Come along now," the student councilman said. "We don't want to keep her waiting."

In no time at all, Fuuka was brought to the Student Council Office. Inside, she saw Mitsuru and Minako, both sitting down at a table and facing each other. Minako turned towards Fuuka, then quickly turned away.

Fuuka wished that the earth would swallow her then and there.

"Thank you," Mitsuru addressed the councilman. "Now, leave us in private."

The councilman nodded, and left the girls alone.

Mitsuru, turning to Fuuka, calmly spoke: "Have a seat, Yamagishi,"

Fuuka immediately complied, knowing that this was not a request.

"Now, do you know why I have summoned you here?" Mitsuru asked, cooly staring at the girls sitting across from her.

Minako and Fuuka looked at each other. "N-no," Fuuka said as levelly as she could.

"We weren't told why we were coming here, so no," Minako said, somewhat more solidly.

Mitsuru paused, closing her eyes and opening them before continuing. "I am already aware of your truancies for the past period, and your breach of dress code is clearly evident," she said, causing Fuuka to squirm uncomfortably. "But that is not why I have brought you here."

"Then, why did you ask for us, Mitsuru-san?" Minako asked.

"This-" Mitsuru brought forth a bag from underneath the table, "-was found in the courtyard near the end of the lunch period."

Fuuka's lips pursed together, her eyes going wide with shock, as Mitsuru revealed the contents: a wadded up bundle consisting of a pair of female Gekkoukan uniforms, as well as two different sets of brightly colored women's underwear. She immediately steadied herself.

"Well?" Mitsuru asked expectantly.

"Well, what?" Minako asked, though not without noticeable unease.

"Are you seriously going to make me spell it out for you?" Mitsuru shook her head disapprovingly. "Two discarded uniforms and undergarments are found during lunch, two students disappear the following period and return without their uniforms, and you two are the only two students to be out of uniform. Everyone else is accounted for," Mitsuru glared at the pair.

"That doesn't necessarily mean it's us!" Minako shouted back. "There's no proof that those clothes are mine. I spilled some of my lunch on my uniform and had to change, and spent the hour cleaning my clothes so they wouldn't stain, but I remembered I had to get to class, so it's probably stuck with the rest of the uniforms in the laundry as well. Check it out for yourself!"

"I don't need to check the school laundry system," said Mitsuru, standing up from her seat and walking towards Minako. "In fact, I don't need to leave this room to determine the validity of your story."

"Y-You don't?" Minako asked, standing up and backing towards the wall.

"Arisato, I must ask you to disrobe!" Mitsuru pointed at Minako.

"What!?"

"Do not make me say it twice!" Mitsuru continued. "Remove your clothing at once. Or I shall do it for you. The culprits do not have underwear, therefore the presence of underwear shall determine your innocence!"

"WAIT!" Fuuka cried out, slamming her arms against the table.

"Fuuka-chan!" Minako gasped.

"No, Minako-chan! No more!" Fuuka shuddered, on the verge of tears. "It was us, Mitsuru-san. But don't punish Minako-chan, it's all my fault anyway."

"But, Fuuka-chan!" said Minako. "You couldn't have known that would happen! Mitsuru-san, I take full responsibility!"

"Enough!" Mitsuru shouted. "Perhaps it would be best to start from the beginning."

---One Explanation Later---

"So what you're telling me," said Mitsuru, clutching her head, "Is that because of a dish Yamagishi cooked using some unique combination of herbs, it somehow hypnotized Arisato into tearing off and disposing of both of your outfits?"

"Um..." said Fuuka.

"Well..." said Minako.

"Yes," said both at once.

"I know it sounds weird," Minako spoke. "But it's all true!"

"You expect me to believe this... 'Naked Stew' really exists?" said Mitsuru incredulously.

"Well, either that's what it does, or it made me act on some primal instinct by giving me an overdose of energy. How else do you explain what happened?" Minako asked.

"Simple," Mitsuru said, tapping her forehead. "Yamagishi's stew had no effect at all, and you simply took advantage of the weather and dragged Yamagishi into your depraved little fantasy. One that you said you've had for some time now, if I recall?"

"That's beside the point!" Minako blushed beet red. "Even if I have, I would never force anyone into it. It's purely a private, personal fantasy like we all have. I never even thought I would do it for real! I'm telling you it was the stew that made me do it!"

"And I'm telling you that is pure nonsense!" Mitsuru snapped back. "I want to believe you, really, I do, but how can you prove this?"

"We can try it ourselves!" Minako said, desperately. "Fuuka-chan cooked it after all! She can do it again!"

"Minako-chan!" Fuuka gasped.

"Hm..." Mitsuru pondered. "Yamagishi?"

"Yes?" Fuuka asked, full of dread.

"Can you make the stew again?"

"I think so. I still have the recipe and spare ingredients."

"Enough for how many?"

"Well, the entire team, and then some," said Fuuka, suddenly realizing Mitsuru's intent. "Wait, no! Mitsuru-san-"

"Then it's settled," said Mitsuru. "We will all settle this tonight, before the Dark Hour."

"Wait, you're bringing everyone into this!?" Minako gasped.

"An adequate sample size is necessary for accurate results," Mitsuru stated, matter-of-factly.

"But, Mitsuru-san, that's too dangerous, even if it was just Minako-chan again!" Fuuka pleaded. "Don't make me cook it the stew, it will end terribly. You have to believe me!"

"Fuuka-chan's right, Mitsuru-san," Minako added. "There's no telling what will happen! I'll take whatever you can throw at me, just please, let this go."

"I believe you enough to test your theory," said Mitsuru. "And I must admit I am curious to see first-hand whether this mystical stew truly exists. But I cannot let this matter slide. After all, you two broke the rules and made a mockery of this institution, and it is only due to our friendship that I am not stringing you up right now. If you are unwilling to provide proof, then I shall have to punish you both for streaking. Not public, of course, but I am aware you've heard of my executions by now."

"Mrg..." Fuuka groaned, looking to Minako for support.

Minako herself seemed to be at a loss. She simply looked back and said, "It's up to you, Fuuka-chan."

If only Mitsuru could have been convinced without putting all of them at risk. But, there seemed to be no alternative. It was either make that accursed dish, or face severe, private, punishment for a crime they were only partially responsible for.

In the end, Fuuka knew what she had to do:

The stew forces them to act on a deeply hidden desire.
133131222111111.content:
"...All right," Fuuka said reluctantly. "I will cook it again."

"Very good," said Mitsuru, giving a small nod. "I am glad that we were able to settle this without further difficulty. Dinner will be at 11:30. You are free to go about the rest of your day as you please as long as that stew is ready by tonight, though I suggest you head on back to the dormitory first thing to get some proper attire."

"Wait a second!" Minako interrupted. "Can't you just give us our clothes back?"

"Unfortunately not," Mitsuru frowned. "Your uniforms have been confiscated as evidence. If anything goes missing before the investigation is closed, then we would have a case of theft on our hands as well. This would lead to increased efforts on our parts to find the culprits, which would not be pleasant for anyone. You know how zealous the Disciplinary Committee can get, don't you Arisato?"

"Oh, right..."

"And furthermore," Mitsuru continued. "Even if most of the students had gone home by now, there are no doubt plenty left on campus. If anyone were to see you have changed clothes again, even more suspicion would be thrown onto you. In fact, you should be lucky that these were claimed before anyone could recognize these as your normal clothes."

"Oh my!" Fuuka gasped. "I hadn't thought about that."

"Indeed, now if you'll excuse me, I must finish up here. Be careful on your way back."

"Yes, Mitsuru-sempai," said both Fuuka and Minako as they left the room.

The trip back to the dorm was uneventful, for the most part. Aside from stares and whispers from remaining students on the way out, and occasional glances from passersby on the monorail and the way home, nothing noticeable happened on the way back to the dorm. But their safe travel did nothing to ease Fuuka's mind. Proceeding in silence, all Fuuka could think about was what was going to happen tonight. She desperately wanted to take her mind off of it, at least temporarily, but she couldn't think of anything else to talk about. Not that Minako seemed to be in a talking mood, anyways. The normally cheery girl had a glum look on her face, staring down at nothing in particular as she walked onward.

Soon enough, the two arrived back at the dorm right around 3:00. "Looks like no one's back yet," Fuuka said.

"Yeah," Minako replied, still deep in her funk.

"Well..." Fuuka continued, walking towards the stairs. "The stew takes several hours to cook so I'll need to get it started soon. We should get changed before the others arrive."

Minako didn't respond immediately, so Fuuka decided to go on ahead, but just as she reached the staircase, Minako spoke. "Wait, Fuuka?"

"Minako?" Fuuka turned around.

"About tonight..." Minako said nervously. "Are you sure?"

"I... yes." Fuuka said, eventually.

"Even if it means you might end up like I did?" Minako asked.

"Yes, even if it means being naked-," Fuuka paused as she uttered the word, cheeks flushing red. "-in front of everyone. I can't let you take the fall for this."

"Um, actually," Minako said uneasily. "Embarrassing as it would be, the naked part is not what I'm worried about."

"Huh!?" Fuuka gaped. "Then, is it because you really are-"

"NO! NO! I't's not like that, Fuuka-chan!" Minako stammered. "It's just, I trust everyone on this team with my life. What's a little nudity between friends like us?"

"Everyone... Even Junpei?"

"Hey, he's not that bad once you get to know him!" Minako laughed. "But yeah, everyone. And besides, they'll be in the same boat as us," she winked. "So we're not getting a completely raw deal this time."

Fuuka flashed red as a tomato as the mental image of all the guys naked popped into her head.

"That is, if it all works out..." Minako continued, her grimness returning.

"Huh? What do you mean?" Fuuka asked, shaking the image out of her head.

"Fuuka-chan, even though I wasn't completely myself back on the roof, I wasn't lying when I told you about wanting to go streaking. But just as I told Mitsuru later, it was a hidden, deeply hidden urge I had. I've been thinking... what if that stew simply brought it out?"

"What do you mean, brought it out?"

"I mean, I had... entertained... the thought of streaking well before eating the stew. What if the stew didn't create the urge to streak, but simply gave me the energy, courage, and recklessness to try and live that fantasy? And if that's the case, what would it be like if everyone had it happen to them all at once?"

"Minako-chan..." Fuuka drew off, thinking.

"..."

"Don't worry about it," she said, boldly.

"Fuuka-chan?"

"You said it yourself, you trust everybody on this team with your life, right? Then I will trust in them too. Even if these 'urges' are unleashed, I think we can handle it. And who knows? Maybe some of them aren't perverted, but just stupid, like doing a song and dance routine."

"I hadn't thought about that..." Minako said.

"And you know what else?" Fuuka continued, getting worked up. "If Mitsuru is going to force us into this situation, then I can't wait to see what happens when she eats her helping!"

"Mitsuru? That would be too priceless! Ha ha ha..." Minako laughed, looking somewhat relieved. "Thanks, Fuuka-chan, I think we can get through this now. Let's get ready."

-------

Later that night, it was time for the stew experiment to commence. Seated at the table were Fuuka, Minako, and Mitsuru, as well as the other members SEES: fellow students Yukari, Junpei, Akihiko, Ken, and Shinjiro. All were dressed in preparation for the Dark Hour, weapons at their sides. In addition, at the foot of the table, happily chomping away at his own dinner, was their canine teammate, Koromaru, and over by Mitsuru's side stood the android Aigis.

"Welcome, everyone," Mitsuru greeted after everyone had taken their seats. "Tonight we are trying something different."

"I'll say!" Junpei exclaimed. "What's the deal with us having dinner so late?"

"I admit it is rather odd, but tonight's meal may prove to be quite special, isn't that right, Yamagishi?" she turned towards Fuuka.

"You made this?" Shinjiro asked, narrowing his already narrow gaze.

"Yes," Fuuka replied, taking the response in stride. It was understandable that he would be skeptical, as he had witnessed a few of her earlier cooking attempts, and had given some very helpful pointers.

"According to Yamagishi, and Arisato who has already tasted this meal," Mitsuru continued. "It should revitalize you and give you an enormous amount of energy. That is what we are going to test tonight."

"It looks like ordinary stew to me, what's makes this special?" Yukari asked.

"Well, the beef and potatoes are standard, but the herbs I added is what gives this its kick."

"Uh-"

"All according to the recipe," Fuuka cut Shinjiro off.

"And you tried this before Minako-chan?" Akihiko asked. "How was it?"

"The flavor's a bit strong," Minako said, reflexively glancing at Fuuka. "But it actually tastes pretty good."

"Can we start eating now?" Ken interrupted. "It's almost time for the Dark Hour, and we can't fight while hungry."

"Kid's got a point," Junpei shrugged. "Chow time!"

And with that, they began to dig in. Just like with Minako earlier on the roof, the first bite seemed to give them pause, but after that they continued steadily eating away. Fuuka for her part, was very conflicted. While she was glad that she was able to provide support through her cooking, she knew it would start getting messed up soon. It would only be a matter of time now...

No, thinking like that now wouldn't help. The meal's been cooked, they were all in this together. Fuuka looked down at her own portion. It was funny, all this chaos over her dish and she hadn't even tried it yet. Taking a bite, the first thing Fuuka noticed was the taste. That flavor was strong all right! She was only able to barely just get it down, chasing it with some water. But it did actually taste really good. Taking a second bite, she felt that the flavor not quite as sharp as before, probably now that she knew it was coming.

"Mm!"

Fuuka turned, and Mitsuru's face drawn as she swallowed, the same reaction she had to the first bite. Had Mitsuru waited until everyone was eating before she began as well, or was it just Minako and Fuuka she was waiting for? However, these questions soon dissipated as Fuuka's thoughts turned solely toward eating more and more of that delicious stew.

The meal passed quickly, and was soon over. Fuuka sat back in her seat, full and content. Looking around, she saw that the rest of the team members were sitting likewise. Even Mitsuru seemed more relaxed than usual.

Still, that rest wouldn't last long. Already Fuuka could feel something welling up from within her belly. As the feeling grew spread throughout her body, she felt herself begin to heat up as well. The side effects had taken hold of her, and the rest of the team as well. What was going to happen?
133131222111111.title: Agree to cook the stew.

choices: Things get crazier...
1331312221111112.content:
"This is great!" "Amazing!" "I feel like I could take on the world!" "Three cheers for Fuuka-chan!" "I feel so alive!" everyone started speaking at once all over each other. Fueled with the energy of the mysterious stew, they were feeling just like Minako was on the roof earlier that day. Hyped up, excited, and ready to do anything.

"Everyone!" Mitsuru announced, exuberant yet still composed. "It seems that Yamagishi's dish was a success after all."

Everyone cheered at Fuuka, who was sitting tall in her seat, breathing excitedly.

"Now that we're completely refreshed, it's 10 minutes until the Dark Hour, enough time to-"

"SHINJI!" Akihiko yelled, interrupting Mitsuru's speech.

"Akihiko!" Mitsuru shouted.

"This won't take long," Akihiko shouted back, jumping from his chair and pointing at Shinjiro. "Shinji! It's time we settled this!"

"Settled what?" Shinji replied, confused.

"Once and for all, which of us is stronger," Akihiko said, removing his vest and tie and starting to take off his shirt. "One-on-one, no-holds-barred, last man standing."

"Akihiko," Mitsuru glared. "What are you doing?"

"It'll only take five minutes Mitsuru," he said, now barechested and bouncing from foot to foot. "It's just something a man's gotta do."

"Five minutes huh?" Shinjiro replied. "Someone's feeling confident, but no can do. Because I-" he pointed at Fuuka. "Have a score of my own to settle!"

"What, me!?" Fuuka gasped. Energized as she was, that didn't mean she couldn't be surprised or intimidated.

"Yes, you, this meal..." said Shinjiro. "How could have gotten so good in such a short time!? I've never cooked anything like this in my entire life! I must know what you did!"

"I-I'm happy to give you the recipe," said Fuuka.

"Uh-uh, no way," Akihiko interjected, placing himself between Fuuka and Shinjiro. "Not until we settle our score."

"Tch! Fine then," Shinjiro growled, taking off his coat and shirt as well. "Like men it is!"

"Shinjiro, Akihiko, stop! I demand order!" Mitsuru yelled, slamming her fist onto the table.

"Woo! Check out the gun show! Whe-Whew! Keep it coming, studs!" Yukari whistled lewdly, leaning back in her chair, a huge grin on her face.

"Takeba!?" Mitsuru whirled around, her face contorted in bafflement.

"Come on, Mitsuru!" Yukari whined. "Just because I'm a girl I can't find hot guys hot? Is it not proper to let a fine young man know just how handsome he is? Is it demeaning to treat guys how they always treat me?"

"No, that's not what I- look!" Mitsuru face-palmed. "This has gotten completely out of hand!"

"Hey, if you like those," Minako cut in, having crept over to Yukari's side. "Then check out these babies!" With a flourish, she undid her jacket and blouse and tossed them off onto the floor, flexing her bare, toned arms inches away from Yukari's face.

"M-Minako-chan! I-! Oh! Oh my!" Yukari swooned. "Oooh... Such definition. I never would have expected-! These are great too..."

"Damn, so it was true... Aigis, restrain Arisato!" Mitsuru commanded.

In a flash, Aigis ran behind Minako and pulled her arms behind her back, holding her in place.

"Hey, watch it!" Minako winced.

"Mitsuru!?" Yukari gasped.

"We cannot take any chances," Mitsuru growled. "If left unrestrained she will soon disrobe entirely. Just like earlier today, when she threw all caution out the window and disgraced our fair school!"

"Huh? Wait, that means, you were the streaker, Minako-chan?" Yukari asked, mouth agape. "But you said you got your uniform dirty at lunch and had to change!"

"Heheh, yeah, that was a lie," Minako chuckled. "As it turns out, I dumped my clothes off the roof and someone found them before I could get them, forcing me to sneak around naked until I could find and wear my gym clothes. It was intense, and a bit scary, but also was the greatest thrill ever! Ain't that right, Fuuka-chan?"

"Y-yes," said Fuuka, who, under the effect of the euphoria, was viewing the memories in an uncharacteristically favorable light. "I got roped into it as well. It was unlike anything I'd ever done before."

"Fuuka-chan too?" Yukari blinked in disbelief.

"Boy, when Mitsuru found out it was us, she was so pissed, ha ha! Though I have to wonder," Minako turned toward the fuming redhead. "For someone who likes to uphold decency and the rules so much, you don't seem to have a problem showing off my bra to everyone like this," she motioned her eyes down to her chest, partly sticking out thanks to how Aigis was holding her.

"Silence that scandalous tongue of yours!" Mitsuru roared, temper rising with her spiked energy.

*DOOF* *BAP* *CRUNCH* the sounds of fists and fury rang from across the room.

"Argh," Mitsuru groaned. "And would you two stop fighting already? This is pointless!"

"Yeah, stop making Mama Mitsuru mad!" uttered Ken, who had stumbled forth and pointed his spear at the quarreling duo.

The entire room paused at that outburst, including the two half-naked brawlers, who were starting to get covered in bruises from each others' punches.

"Mama?" Fuuka whispered under her breath, stifling her laughter.

"I'm... going to pretend I didn't hear that," said Mitsuru.

"It seems the stew has affected Ken-kun somewhat differently than everyone else," Aigis stated.

"Ken, stay out of this," said Akihiko. "We'll be done soon enough."

"Does that mean you're giving up? Cause I've got plenty more fight left within me." Shinjiro taunted.

"You call yourselves men?" Ken glared with half-lidded eyes. "To cause all this trouble for someone so wonderful and tough, strict yet caring, just like my mom was until she..." he paused. "Anyways, you two started all this, so apologize!"

"I can't believe it," Junpei finally spoke, having remained quiet up until now.

"Oh great, Stupei finally joins the party..." Yukari rolled her eyes. "What, gonna be all disappointed that you missed Minako-chan's earlier show at school?"

"Shut up!" Junpei shouted, glaring at her. "This isn't about that, Yuka-tan! What Minako-chan did today..." he clutched his fist, turning towards the floor. "How can I hope to measure up to that!?"

"Eh?" Minako asked.

"You lost me," Yukari said flatly.

"Every time, you show me up every time," Junpei grumbled. "As a Persona-user, as a leader... we joined the group at the same time, but you've left me in the dust from the very beginning. I thought at least I could be secure in my status as a lovable, happy-go-lucky class clown, but then you take that from me too by pulling off the ultimate prank! Streaking the school and almost not getting caught? How can anyone hope to top that?"

"Um..." went Fuuka.

"Ugh..." Yukari grimaced.

"Iori... that is hardly something to be envious of," said Mitsuru.

"Shut up!" said Junpei. "Well, I'm not gonna take this lying down. You think you're bad just because you streaked the school? Well, I'm going to streak Tartarus!"

"Junpei-kun," Minako shook her head. "What good would that do? There's no one there in Tartarus to hide our bodies from, other than shadows, and I don't think they care whether we're clothes or not. Where's the thrill in that?"

"Oh, this isn't about sneaking, Minako-chan," Junpei smirked. "This is about conquest."

"Conquest?" Minako asked, puzzled.

"Think about it," Junpei said, waggling his finger. "One man, his weapon, his persona, a gauntlet of shadows, and nothing else. With only his wit, his magic, and his blade at his side, fighting against impossible odds; it is the ultimate test of manhood. What do you think?"

"Junpei," said Yukari. "That has got to be the most stup-"

"Brilliant!" Minako exclaimed. "I've been wracking my mind trying to think of what could be better than plain old streaking, and you just gave me the perfect answer!"

"Seriously?" Yukari asked. "You do realize he just wants to see you naked, Minako-chan,"

"No, no he doesn't," Minako smirked. "I mean, sure he does, but, it's more than that, I can tell."

"Yeah, this is about a man's pride. So, that means you accept my challenge?" Junpei grinned evilly.

"Of course!" Minako beamed. "This is going to be so stimulating!"

"Absolutely not!" said Mitsuru, brandishing her rapier towards Minako, resting the tip near her neck. "Such foul, disgusting behavior needs to be dealt with at once. Prepare to be exe-"

"Gwargh!" Ken screamed.

"Amada!" Mitsuru yelled. She turned and saw Ken knocked down on the ground, rubbing his now-bloodied nose. Like the others, he had taken his shirt and jacket off as well. Akihiko was standing above him, rubbing his knuckles. "Now, where were we, Shinji?" he asked, turning back to his original opponent.
